author: Jeff Piker (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Pirates shock Pottsville 29-14
text: slideshow POTTSVILLE â€” The Dover Pirates took advantage of Pottsville Apaches miscues in the second quarter, and the Apaches were never able to recover.Dover scored two second quarter touchdowns and amassed a lead that Pottsville was never able to overcome on the way to a 29-14 win on Friday at John Needham Stadium.Dover received the opening kick and promptly drove 62 yards on 10 plays to take a 6-0 lead with 5:42 left in the opening quarter. Luke Price carried the ball in from the 6-yard line. The Pirates missed the extra point.The Apaches answered by putting together a 64-yard drive in six plays. Alec Metz scored on a pitch from Jake Dugger around the left side for a 29-yard touchdown. Pottsville also missed their extra point and tied the game as 6-6. Dover was forced to punt on their next possession and Pottsville took over at their own 13-yard line. Jacob Sharp intercepted the Pottsville pass at the Apaches 46-yard line and seemed to turn the momentum of the game.On the next play, Price handed off to Josh Jones who broke up the middle of the Apaches defense for the touchdown. Price found Seth Cheak in the end zone for the two-point conversion and Dover opened up a 14-6 lead.After forcing Pottsville to punt, Price found Ben Dale Jacob Sharp for the 62-yard touchdown throw and catch. Dale added the conversion and the Pirates extended the lead to 22-6 at halftime.Pottsville took the ball at the 10 with 4:45 left in the third and went 90 yards in 19 plays to close the gap to 22-12, when Austin McNeely went over the left side for the touchdown. The 2-point conversion pass from Dugger to Austin Bell made it 22-14 with 8:00 left in the game.Dover closed the door on any chance of an Apache comeback when Price carried the ball into the end zone with 1:29 left in the game. The Pirate PAT made it 29-14. Price finished the night 5-of-7 for 120 yards and a touchdown. Dial led the Pirate rushing attack with 88 yards. The Apaches were led by Metzs with 66 yards on the ground and Jake Dugger adding 149 yards through the air.Dover will host Ozark on Friday, while Pottsville travels to Subiaco Academy.
